title: Features
content:
“Sound game training” app is an app for practicing sound games.
You can check the notes by playing back the video, and you can also pseudo-play by touching on the video.
Adding a Playback Video There are four ways to add videos to play in the application.
Camera Roll The Camera Roll is the place where videos are saved when you take a video on your device. You can view it from the Photos app.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “Camera Roll” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
iCloud Drive iCloud Drive is an online storage service provided by Apple. You can view it in the Files app.
Here’s how to add them in this application.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “iCloud Drive” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Transfer from PC It’s a way to transfer videos from the Music (formerly iTunes) application on your PC to the application storage on your device.
“Use iTunes to share files between your computer and your iOS or iPadOS device” page will tell you how to transfer it to the app, please see here.
Here’s how to add them in this application.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “Within the app” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Play YouTube Video YouTube is a video sharing service provided by Google. There are videos of sound games uploaded by others.
Here’s how to add them in this application.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “YouTube” from the list of alternatives Go to the video page you want to add on the YouTube site Click the “Add video” button at the bottom right of the video page Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Since the application does not download YouTube videos, traffic is generated every time a video is played in this application.
 Pseudo game You won’t be paused by tapping on the playing video screen.
So you can play a pseudo sound game.
There are many other features that make practicing easier.
 Adjust the video playback speed
You can adjust the playback speed in the range of 0.25-2.00x speed. Adjust the start/end position of video playback
You can set the start and end of the play area to focus on the difficult parts of the game. Zoom in/out and adjust the position of the video
Scaling and positioning can be done to make the video fit the device resolution. Flipping the video screen
The video screen can be flipped left to right Support for both portrait and landscape video
You can fix your device orientation in portrait or landscape mode. Shortcut key to rewind/fast forward a few seconds during playback
The shortcut key is set up so that you can easily manipulate the time without having to pause and use the seek bar.  Bookmark the playback position  There is a function to register the start/end position of video playback as a bookmark.
By setting the playback start/end position for each number, you can quickly change the playback position for the part you want to practise.
Supports a variety of game lines  The touchline of the sound game is often different for each device. The touchline position of the desired video and the device may be different.
To solve this problem, the app supports a guide to help you align the touchline on your device.
Supported games are listed below.
 Deemo VOEZ Arcaea Dynamix BanG Dream! Project Sekai Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE! Theater Days THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA GIRLS STARLIGHT STAGE THE IDOLM@STER SideM GROWING STARS Love Live! School idol festival HYPNOSISMIC -A.R.B- Ensemble Stars!! Music Re:Stage! Prism Step D4DJ Groovy Mix Tokyo 7th Sisters Uta Macross Girlfriend (note) Touhou Danmaku Kagura  Depending on the device where you recorded the playback video, you may not be able to adjust the touch position.

title: FAQ
content:
Video    Q. Do you think I can practice playing music with an app that only plays videos?   Here are some things you can do to improve your practice.
- No pausing by tapping the screen during playback
- You can set the playback area
- You can adjust the playback speed
- Video expansion, contraction and movement is possible
Just tapping the screen while playing the part you're weak at is good enough practice ðŸ’ª
So start practicing today â™ª~        Q. Can I orient it vertically?   "Video Selection" You can change the orientation by tapping the "Device is rotating" icon in the lower left corner of the screen.
Tap again to return to landscape mode.        Q. Is it possible to make a touch sound?   You can set up the touch sound in "Settings  Settings on Video  Sound" in the app.
There are different types of touch sounds, so you can choose the one you like best â™ª~        Q. Can I see the touch points?   You can adjust the display settings for touch from "Settings  Settings on Video  Point" in the application.
You can also customize the color and size of the display to make it your own. â™ª~        Q. Can I adjust the volume of the touch tone?   You cannot do this in the app. Please adjust the volume on your device.        Q. The home bar gets in the way during pseudo-play, making it difficult to play. Is there a home bar setting?   You can ignore the first Home Bar operation by going to "Settings  Video  Home Bar" in the application.        Q. I'm having trouble with the tap position and the pause button being in the same place in some playback videos. Can you fix this?   You can change the pause button to a long tap.
On the "Folder List" screen, you can select "Edit  Settings on Video  Pause button" to switch to long tap.        Q. Where can I set up the touchscreen display in the application?   On the "Folder List" screen, you can set it up by going to "Edit  Select Folder  App Type".        Q. Can you fix the sound shift?   There is no way to solve this problem within the application, but I hope to address it someday.        Q. Is there a way to fast-forward or rewind a few seconds?   You can set it using the "Folder Settings  Fast forward/rewind button" button at the bottom left of the folder/video list screen.
You can also adjust the position of the display on the video screen and the number of seconds â™ª~        Q. Can I reposition or hide the rewind/fast forward button?   You can change or hide the position.
You can set it using the "Folder Settings  Fast forward/rewind button" button at the bottom left of the folder/video list screen.        Q. The resolution of my YouTube videos is low. Can I change it?   You can choose from 240p/360p/720p. The default setting is 360p.
You can configure the settings from "Common Settings  Video traffic" at the bottom left of the video list screen.       Q. When will the "xxx" application type be added?   It is difficult to support the recent iOS devices due to the increase in the number of different ratios. In addition, there are more and more apps that allow you to adjust the touchline position on the sound game app side, so it is not worth it.
This is why the frequency of updating the app types is low. However, that doesn't mean we don't want to increase the frequency.     Requests/bugs    Q. Where do I submit my request?   Please send us your request from "Contact" in the app. We can't accept all requests, but we will consider them.
I'm also open to reviews on the AppStore. However, it is difficult to communicate with them, so we may not be able to understand their intentions.        Q. Where do I report bugs?   Please send us your request from the "Contact" section of the app. Since it is difficult to communicate with AppStore reviews, it may not be possible to reproduce them and there may be a delay in responding.        Q. YouTube videos no longer play in the app. Is this a bug?   It's most likely a bug. Please contact us from the "Contact" section of the app, including the URL of the video that is not playing.        Q. Videos from my camera roll no longer play in the app. Is this a bug?   Deleting a video from the camera roll will stop it from playing.
If you choose to save photos to iCloud, they will not be playable at a later date. Please register the video uploaded to iCloud to the application.
If you have videos in your camera roll but they do not play, try restarting the app/device to see if that solves the problem.       Q. The video position appears in a strange place on the video screen. Can this be fixed?   After clicking "Play  Stop" on the video screen, touch the "grid icon" in the lower left corner of the screen and swipe the screen to move the position.     Other    Q. Can't I get rid of ads through in-app purchases?   You can turn them off by joining as a supporter.
For details, please tap the "Hide Ads" button at the bottom of the video list screen.        Q. Do you accept donations?   I accept from the Tip link in the top left menu.       Q. Will you be distributing the Android app?   Distribution started on 08/06/2022.
For the Android version, please refer to the following website.
https://hyoromo.github.io/sound-game-training-android/
